album_type.description: The type of the album: one of 'album', 'single', or 'compilation'.

artists.description: The artists of the album. Each artist object includes a link in href to more detailed information about the artist.

available_markets.description: The markets in which the album is available: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes. Note that an album is considered available in a market when at least 1 of its tracks is available in that market.

copyrights.description: The copyright statements of the album.

text.description: The copyright text for this album.

type.description: The type of copyright: C = the copyright, P = the sound recording (performance) copyright.

external_ids.description: Known external IDs for this album.

properties.description: The identifier type, for example: 'isrc' - International Standard Recording Code, 'ean' - International Article Number, 'upc' - Universal Product Code

external_urls.description: Known external URLs for this album.

properties.description: The type of the URL, for example: 'spotify' - The Spotify URL for the object.

genres.description: A list of the genres used to classify the album. For example: 'Prog Rock', 'Post-Grunge'. (If not yet classified, the array is empty.)

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the album.

id.description: The Spotify ID for the album.

images.description: The cover art for the album in various sizes, widest first.

popularity.description: The popularity of the album. The value will be between 0 and 100, with 100 being the most popular. The popularity is calculated from the popularity of the album's individual tracks.

release_date.description: The date the album was first released, for example '1981-12-15'. Depending on the precision, it might be shown as '1981' or '1981-12'.

release_date_precision.description: The precision with which release_date value is known: 'year', 'month', or 'day'.

uri.description: The Spotify URI for the album.
